text:
Facebook ready to broadcast live video on its iPhone app
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Facebook is ready to start broadcasting live video on its iPhone app.
The option to show live video is being turned on Thursday for everyone in the U.S. with Facebook's app installed on an iPhone. The California company plans to extend the iPhone feature to all 1.6 billion of its worldwide users in the next few weeks.
The feature will enable Facebook users to share live video with friends and family. It's similar to the live video app called Periscope that Twitter introduced on its messaging service last year.
